column4: hi all. how can i tell ubuntu lucid to use the graphic driver i want in stead of vesa driver, when there is no xorg.conf file?
normaly if your card is supported it uses the best.  only if nothing else is found will id go to vesa
lspci to find card you have
joe : 01:00.0 VGA compatible controller: Silicon Integrated Systems [SiS] 661/741/760 PCI/AGP or 662/761Gx PCIE VGA Display Adapter
i just need to tell ubuntu to use sis driver instead of vesa
i managed to do it some time ago after some how to
now i cant find the website and so...
i know if i use sis driver i get the right resolution
joe : yeah man i know this xorg.conf was the solution
there must be a way to tell ubuntu to use the driver i want.
I see a group at http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1526038 that are working on your problem but not sure it's a solution
